about.summary: Several functions are available for calculating the most widely used effect sizes (ES), along with their variances, confidence intervals and p-values.  The output includes ES's of d (mean difference), g (unbiased estimate of d), r (correlation coefficient), z' (Fisher's z), and OR (odds ratio and log odds ratio). In addition, NNT (number needed to treat), U3, CLES (Common Language Effect Size) and Cliff's Delta are computed. This package uses recommended formulas as described in The Handbook of Research Synthesis and Meta-Analysis (Cooper, Hedges, & Valentine, 2009).

Several functions are available for calculating the most widely used effect sizes (ES), along with their variances, confidence intervals and p-values.  The output includes ES's of d (mean difference), g (unbiased estimate of d), r (correlation coefficient), z' (Fisher's z), and OR (odds ratio and log odds ratio). In addition, NNT (number needed to treat), U3, CLES (Common Language Effect Size) and Cliff's Delta are computed. This package uses recommended formulas as described in The Handbook of Research Synthesis and Meta-Analysis (Cooper, Hedges, & Valentine, 2009).

name: r-compute.es
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '0.2-5' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-compute.es
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/compute.es_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/compute.es/compute.es_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: a826d309928f56e9a38ae330009354fb4794e5dab0bf6e5deee0bc41871e2300

build:
  number: 4
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
  run:
    - r-base

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('compute.es')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('compute.es')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: http://acdelre.com
  license: GPL-2.0-only
  summary: Several functions are available for calculating the most widely used effect sizes
    (ES), along with their variances, confidence intervals and p-values.  The output
    includes ES's of d (mean difference), g (unbiased estimate of d), r (correlation
    coefficient), z' (Fisher's z), and OR (odds ratio and log odds ratio). In addition,
    NNT (number needed to treat), U3, CLES (Common Language Effect Size) and Cliff's
    Delta are computed. This package uses recommended formulas as described in The Handbook
    of Research Synthesis and Meta-Analysis (Cooper, Hedges, & Valentine, 2009).
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: compute.es
# Type: Package
# Title: Compute Effect Sizes

# Date: 2020-04-01

# Maintainer: AC Del Re <acdelre@gmail.com>
# Description: Several functions are available for calculating the most widely used effect sizes (ES), along with their variances, confidence intervals and p-values.  The output includes ES's of d (mean difference), g (unbiased estimate of d), r (correlation coefficient), z' (Fisher's z), and OR (odds ratio and log odds ratio). In addition, NNT (number needed to treat), U3, CLES (Common Language Effect Size) and Cliff's Delta are computed. This package uses recommended formulas as described in The Handbook of Research Synthesis and Meta-Analysis (Cooper, Hedges, & Valentine, 2009).
# Depends: R (>= 2.10.1)
# License: GPL-2
# URL: http://acdelre.com
# NeedsCompilation: no
